content.text:
I'll start by exploring the codebase to understand its current structure.

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Glob">
<parameter name="pattern">**/*</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
["CLAUDE.md", "README.md", "plugins/project-setup/README.md", "plugins/project-setup/package.json", "plugins/project-setup/plugin.toml", "plugins/project-setup/tsconfig.json", "plugins/project-setup/src/index.ts", "plugins/project-setup/.claude/settings.json"]
</result>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/project-setup/src/index.ts</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
import Anthropic from "@anthropic-ai/sdk";

const client = new Anthropic();

async function main() {
  const result = await client.messages.create({
    model: "claude-sonnet-4-20250514",
    max_tokens: 1024,
    messages: [{ role: "user", content: "Hello, Claude" }],
  });
  console.log(result);
}

main();

</result>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/project-setup/plugin.toml</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
[plugin]
name = "project-setup"
version = "0.1.0"
description = "Sets up alignment-hive in a new project"

[install]
command = "npm install && npm run build"

[run]
command = "node dist/index.js"

</result>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/project-setup/package.json</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
{
  "name": "project-setup",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "description": "Sets up alignment-hive in a new project",
  "main": "dist/index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "build": "tsc",
    "start": "node dist/index.js"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@anthropic-ai/sdk": "^0.39.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "typescript": "^5.0.0",
    "@types/node": "^20.0.0"
  }
}

</result>

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/yoav/projects/alignment-hive/plugins/project-setup/.claude/settings.json</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
{
  "permissions": {
    "allow": [
      "Bash(npm install)",
      "Bash(npm run build)",
      "Bash(node dist/index.js)",
      "Read",
      "Glob",
      "Grep",
      "Write",
      "Edit"
    ]
  }
}

</result>

I've explored the codebase. This is an early-stage project called **alignment-hive** - Claude Code infrastructure for AI safety researchers. Here's what I found:

## Current Structure

```
alignment-hive/
├── CLAUDE.md          # Project instructions
├── README.md          # Living plan document with priorities
└── plugins/
    └── project-setup/
        ├── plugin.toml        # Plugin manifest
        ├── package.json       # Node dependencies
        ├── tsconfig.json      # TypeScript config
        ├── src/index.ts       # Entry point (placeholder)
        └── .claude/settings.json  # Permissions
```

## Current State

The `project-setup` plugin exists but is just a placeholder - it currently makes a simple API call to Claude and logs the result. The actual setup functionality hasn't been implemented yet.

## Immediate Priorities (from README)

1. Test project-setup plugin locally
2. Read Claude Code Skills Training for memory system design
3. Set up memory system plugin
4. Test locally before setting up GitHub Action

The project aims to provide:
- Plugin/skills marketplace for alignment researchers
- Memory system for learning from sessions
- Common workflow skills (scholar handbook, compute setup, SRPs, etc.)

Is there something specific you'd like me to explore or plan?
